data.title: Multiple Award Schedule — IT
data.meta_description: Find innovative commercial products, services, and solutions from more than 5,000 industry leaders on Multiple Award Schedule — IT, also known as MAS IT or the former Schedule 70.
data.text:
Multiple Award Schedule’s IT Category, known as MAS IT, offers:

7.5 million innovative commercial IT products, services, and solutions from thousands of pre-qualified vendors, large and small.

Acquisition and technology guidance from our subject matter experts and free scope reviews to get you on the right track.

Competitive, flexible pricing structures and customized terms and conditions.

Free pre- and post-award training to help you build comfort and expertise with Multiple Award Schedule.

How do I buy IT on MAS?

MAS IT is open to federal, state, local, and tribal agencies. Some organizations may be eligible to use Cooperative Purchasing and Disaster Purchasing Programs.

MAS is a fixed price with an economic price adjustment Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity contract. The ordering period is continuous, and the contract periods begin on the Date of Award and expire in five years (exclusive of any options). Task order types include firm-fixed price, time and material, or labor hour.

When you’re ready to buy, issue an RFI or RFQ to vendors through eBuy and GSA Advantage.

Buying from small businesses

Your agency may choose to set-aside the requirement for one or more socioeconomic categories. More than half of MAS Information Technology industry partners are small businesses that can help you meet socioeconomic goals, and you can mandate or indicate a preference for small businesses and other set-asides.

To find small businesses selling IT on eLibrary,

Choose MAS Information Technology from “Quick Schedules” in the drop down menu on the top right.

Choose your Special Item Number/category.

Choose your socioeconomic indicator/s.

Further sort the search results by location or download them to a spreadsheet.

Follow FAR 8.4 Federal Supply Schedules ordering procedures to do business with the selected vendors.

Learn more about buying from small businesses on MAS.

What’s available on MAS IT?

SINs and subcategories

MAS offerings are represented by Special Item Numbers, or SINs, which can be combined to meet your requirements. IT SINs fall within several subcategories:

Browse all MAS offerings and filter by IT category to find commercial IT solutions that work for your agency. Refer to the IT Category attachment of the current MAS solicitation for a list of all MAS IT subcategories.

Blanket purchase agreements

BPAs are a great option for recurring needs and can help your agency meet strategic sourcing, compliance requirements, and socioeconomic goals.

Our 2GIT BPA offers pre-competed commercial hardware, software, and ancillary services from large and small businesses.

Our GSS for Desktops and Laptops BPA offers standard configurations for desktop and laptop computers.

Our SmartBUY BPA offers pre-negotiated terms and conditions on commercial software.

You can establish a BPA with GSA MAS contractors using the authority and instructions under FAR 8.405-3, Blanket Purchase Agreements.

Other IT contract vehicles and purchasing programs

Our Governmentwide Acquisition Contracts offer flexible access to customized IT solutions from a large, diverse pool of industry partners.

Enterprise Infrastructure Solutions is the federal government’s recommended contract vehicle for enterprise telecommunications and networking services.

How do I sell IT on MAS?

Current contract holders can submit a modification to add a SIN in the eOffer/eMod portal.

If you’re new to MAS, follow the MAS Roadmap guidance for preparing and sending an offer. Your business may be eligible to use FASt Lane.

Need help with selling?

Contact the Vendor Support Center.

Tell us what you think
